titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. P. H. Cornant and Jesse Thompson, Indictment
CWG0921

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
Livingston Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
P. H. Conant & Jesse Thompson

The Grand Jury of Livingston County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse P. H. Conant & Jesse Thompson of the offense of wrongfully refusing a vote at an Election committed as follows viz:

The said P. H. Conant & Jesse Thompson on the 3rd day of August 1863, in the County aforesaid being Judges of an Election at Precinct No 1. in said County did Knowingly and unlawfully Refuse M. H. Carson a qualified voter of said County to permit him to vote at said Election for the following named person Viz C. A. Wickliffe a candidate for Governor of Kentucky, at said election. Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Information by
M. H. Carson
J. C. Hodge
J. W. Richardson
A Copy att J W. Cade C L C C

Endorsed "A True Bill"
Signed "R. S. Boyd Foreman Grand Jury"
Attest
J. W. Cade Clk

The Indictment a Copy whereof may be seen on the 1st page of this sheet was filed in Court: Bail fixed at $100. & process awarded on the 18th day of February 1864, at the same time were filed another against same parties of same term for refusing a vote to W. Canada for C A Wickliffe for Governor & L. S. Trimble for Congress, another for Refusing to permit C. Haynes a vote for Wicklife. Another for Refusing D. B. Sanders a like vote. another for Refusing J. T. Handlin a vote for C A Wickliffe for Governor and Cowgill for Congress, and another for Refusing N. H. Bigham to vote for Wickliffe making Six against said parties. Also at said time said Grand Jury Returned "a true bill" from indictments against Thomas M Groom and C. G. Halstead Judges of Election in Precinct No 2. the first for Refusing Anthony Foster a vote for C A Wickliffe for Governor. and for W B Read for Lt. Governor

2nd for Refusing W. H. Yancey a vote for C A Wickliffe for Governor. L. S. Trimble for Congress & C Bennett for the Legislature
3rd for Refusing John Jones a like vote
4th for refusing G. S. Walker a like vote.

Attest
James W. Cade C L c c

The interference of the Military with elections is ever to be deplored as endangering the security which the free elective franchise alone can give. But the officers who acted under the constraint of Military force should not be held Criminally accountable for an act not voluntary but constrained by duress -- I therefore order a pardon for the offence charged on each of the within named cases --
